DataElement.preferredName: Patient Measurable Disease International Myeloma Working Group Criterion Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine study eligibility as to whether the patient has measurable disease defined by the International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG) criteria as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Measurable Disease or Disorder International Myeloma Working Group Criterion Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Capable of being measured._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A working group established to conduct basic, clinical and translational research in a collaborative manner to improve outcomes in myeloma and to provide scientifically valid and critically appraised consensus opinions on the diagnosis and treatment of myeloma and related disorders._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Measurable Disease or Disorder International Myeloma Working Group Criterion Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Capable of being measured.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A working group established to conduct basic, clinical and translational research in a collaborative manner to improve outcomes in myeloma and to provide scientifically valid and critically appraised consensus opinions on the diagnosis and treatment of myeloma and related disorders.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

A working group established to conduct basic, clinical and translational research in a collaborative manner to improve outcomes in myeloma and to provide scientifically valid and critically appraised consensus opinions on the diagnosis and treatment of myeloma and related disorders.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have measurable
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease defined by any of the following IMWG criteria: Serum M-protein greater than or equal to 0.5 g/dL or for IgA myeloma, an elevated IgA level by quantitative IgA nephelometry OR Urine M-protein greater than or equal to 200 mg in a 24-hour collection OR Serum Free Light Chain level greater than or equal to 10 mg/dL with an abnormal free light chain ratio OR Measurable plasmacytoma by cross sectional imaging (computed tomography [CT], magnetic resonance imaging [MRI] or [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography with CT [FDG PET/CT]) OR 20% or more light chain restricted, clonal plasma cells in the bone marrow?
